endpoints.desc:
This API is called by the homeserver when it wants to present clients
with specific information about the various third party networks that
an application service supports.

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** Fields which may be used to identify a third party user. These should be
ordered to suggest the way that entities may be grouped, where higher
groupings are ordered first. For example, the name of a network should be
searched before the nickname of a user.
res_tables.title: [string]

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** Fields which may be used to identify a third party location. These should be
ordered to suggest the way that entities may be grouped, where higher
groupings are ordered first. For example, the name of a network should be
searched before the name of a channel.
res_tables.title: [string]

res_tables.desc: **Required.** A content URI representing an icon for the third party protocol.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** The type definitions for the fields defined in the ``user_fields`` and 
``location_fields``. Each entry in those arrays MUST have an entry here. The
``string`` key for this object is field name itself.

May be an empty object if no fields are defined.
res_tables.title: Field Types

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A list of objects representing independent instances of configuration.
For example, multiple networks on IRC if multiple are provided by the
same application service.
res_tables.title: [Protocol Instance]

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A regular expression for validation of a field's value. This may be relatively
coarse to verify the value as the application service providing this protocol
may apply additional validation or filtering.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** An placeholder serving as a valid example of the field value.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** A human-readable description for the protocol, such as the name.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
An optional content URI representing the protocol. Overrides the one provided
at the higher level Protocol object.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Preset values for ``fields`` the client may use to search by.
res_tables.title: object

res_tables.desc: **Required.** A unique identifier across all instances.
res_tables.title: string

responses.description: The protocol was found and metadata returned.

The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.
The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.
No protocol was found with the given path.

endpoints.title: Retrieve metadata about a specific protocol that the application service supports.

endpoints.desc:
This API is called by the homeserver in order to retrieve a Matrix
User ID linked to a user on the third party network, given a set of
user parameters.

query.desc:
One or more custom fields that are passed to the application
service to help identify the user.
query.title: string

res_tables.desc: List of matched third party users.
res_tables.title: [User]

res_tables.desc: **Required.** A Matrix User ID represting a third party user.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The protocol ID that the third party location is a part of.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Information used to identify this third party location.
res_tables.title: object

responses.description: The Matrix User IDs found with the given parameters.

The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.
The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.
No users were found with the given parameters.

endpoints.title: Retrieve the Matrix User ID of a corresponding third party user.

endpoints.desc: Retrieve a list of Matrix portal rooms that lead to the matched third party location.

query.desc:
One or more custom fields that are passed to the application
service to help identify the third party location.
query.title: string

res_tables.desc: List of matched third party locations.
res_tables.title: [Location]

res_tables.desc: **Required.** An alias for a matrix room.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The protocol ID that the third party location is a part of.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Information used to identify this third party location.
res_tables.title: object

responses.description: At least one portal room was found.

The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.
The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.
No mappings were found with the given parameters.

endpoints.title: Retrieve Matrix-side portal rooms leading to a third party location.

endpoints.desc:
Retrieve an array of third party network locations from a Matrix room
alias.

query.desc: The Matrix room alias to look up.
query.title: string

res_tables.desc: List of matched third party locations.
res_tables.title: [Location]

res_tables.desc: **Required.** An alias for a matrix room.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The protocol ID that the third party location is a part of.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Information used to identify this third party location.
res_tables.title: object

responses.description: All found third party locations.

The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.
The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.
No mappings were found with the given parameters.

endpoints.title: Reverse-lookup third party locations given a Matrix room alias.

endpoints.desc: Retrieve an array of third party users from a Matrix User ID.

query.desc: The Matrix User ID to look up.
query.title: string

res_tables.desc: List of matched third party users.
res_tables.title: [User]

res_tables.desc: **Required.** A Matrix User ID represting a third party user.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The protocol ID that the third party location is a part of.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Information used to identify this third party location.
res_tables.title: object

responses.description: An array of third party users.

The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.
The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.
No mappings were found with the given parameters.

endpoints.title: Reverse-lookup third party users given a Matrix User ID.

get.description:
Retrieve an array of third party network locations from a Matrix room
alias.

parameters.description: The Matrix room alias to look up.
parameters.name: alias

schema.description: List of matched third party locations.

alias.description: An alias for a matrix room.

fields.description: Information used to identify this third party location.

protocol.description: The protocol ID that the third party location is a part of.

401.description:
The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.

403.description: The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.

404.description: No mappings were found with the given parameters.

get.summary: Reverse-lookup third party locations given a Matrix room alias.

get.description:
This API is called by the homeserver when it wants to present clients
with specific information about the various third party networks that
an application service supports.

200.description: The protocol was found and metadata returned.

additionalProperties.description: Definition of valid values for a field.

placeholder.description: An placeholder serving as a valid example of the field value.

regexp.description:
A regular expression for validation of a field's value. This may be relatively
coarse to verify the value as the application service providing this protocol
may apply additional validation or filtering.

additionalProperties.title: Field Type

field_types.description:
The type definitions for the fields defined in the ``user_fields`` and 
``location_fields``. Each entry in those arrays MUST have an entry here. The
``string`` key for this object is field name itself.

May be an empty object if no fields are defined.
field_types.title: Field Types

icon.description: A content URI representing an icon for the third party protocol.

instances.description:
A list of objects representing independent instances of configuration.
For example, multiple networks on IRC if multiple are provided by the
same application service.

desc.description: A human-readable description for the protocol, such as the name.

fields.description: Preset values for ``fields`` the client may use to search by.

icon.description:
An optional content URI representing the protocol. Overrides the one provided
at the higher level Protocol object.

network_id.description: A unique identifier across all instances.

location_fields.description:
Fields which may be used to identify a third party location. These should be
ordered to suggest the way that entities may be grouped, where higher
groupings are ordered first. For example, the name of a network should be
searched before the name of a channel.

items.description: Field used to identify a third party location.

user_fields.description:
Fields which may be used to identify a third party user. These should be
ordered to suggest the way that entities may be grouped, where higher
groupings are ordered first. For example, the name of a network should be
searched before the nickname of a user.

items.description: Field used to identify a third party user.

schema.description: Dictionary of supported third party protocols.

The homeserver has not supplied credentials to the application service.
Optional error information can be included in the body of this response.

403.description: The credentials supplied by the homeserver were rejected.

404.description: No protocol was found with the given path.
